\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} height of the plot in pixels, default depends on screen resolution

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{colors}} \textendash{} dictionary that holds color information for each of the data categories. The key of the dict should

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{corespond to the name of the data category (column). The value of the dict should be the RGB values of the color:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\{}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{“United States”: {[}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
23,
60,
225

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
{]}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}, default is \{\}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{back\_ground\_color}} \textendash{} color of the background. To hide bars that fall outside of the top X, a square is drawn

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
at the bottom of the visualization. Typically you want this square to match the color of the background. Default is (255,255,255)
:type back\_ground\_color: tuple of length 3 with integers

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use this to add a timestamp to your visualization.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{canvas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tkinter.Canvas}}) \textendash{} tkinter canvas to draw the graph to

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} width of the timestamp in pixels (doesn’t change the font size), default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} height of the timestamp in pixels, this settings also changes the font size, default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the x location of the top left pixel of the timestamp, default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the y location of the top left pixel of the timestamp, default depends on screen resolution

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{prefix}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} text to prefix the timestamp, default is “

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_indicator}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} format of the timestamp, “day”, “month”, “year”, default is “year”

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{font\_color}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple of length 3 with integers}}) \textendash{} font color, default is (0,0,0)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\emph{\DUrole{n}{log\_scale}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{only\_show\_latest\_event}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{allow\_decrease}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{format}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}Europe\textquotesingle{}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{draw\_points}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{area}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{color\_bar\_color}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{[}100, 100, 100{]}, {[}255, 0, 0{]}{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sub\_plot}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use this to add static images to your visualization.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{canvas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tkinter.Canvas}}) \textendash{} tkinter canvas to draw the graph to

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} width of the image in pixels

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{height}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} height of the image in pixels

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the x location of the top left pixel of this image

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} the y location of the top left pixel of this image

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} file location of the image you want to add the canvas, only png files are support

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{on\_top}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} set this to True to always draw this image on top

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
